dcterms:creator: Paul Ekman
dcterms:description: The WASSA dataset is used for emotion detection, focusing on identifying emotions such as sadness, surprise, neutral, anger, fear, disgust, and joy based on essay texts.
dcterms:title: WASSA Dataset

dcterms:creator: Dorottya Demszky
Dana Movshovitz-Attias
Jeong-woo Ko
Alan Cowen
Gaurav Nemade
Sujith Ravi
dcterms:description: The GoEmotions dataset is utilized for augmenting the WASSA dataset, providing a broader range of emotions with 27 different emotion categories.
dcterms:title: GoEmotions Dataset

dcterms:creator: Saif Mohammad
Felipe Bravo-Marquez
Mohammad Salameh
Svetlana Kiritchenko
dcterms:description: The SemEval dataset is referenced for its established benchmarks in emotion classification tasks, particularly in analyzing emotions in tweets.
dcterms:title: SemEval Dataset

dcterms:description: AOUS (Augmented Oversampling) is a derived dataset created to address class imbalance by undersampling or oversampling based on the number of data points per class.
dcterms:title: AOUS (Augmented Oversampling)

dcterms:description: AOS (Augmented Oversampling) is another derived dataset aimed at balancing the dataset by adding comments from the GoEmotions dataset with the highest lengths.
dcterms:title: AOS (Augmented Oversampling)

dcterms:description: RSO (Random Synthetic Oversampling) is a derived dataset that creates synthetic essays by concatenating multiple random comments with the same emotion to address class imbalance.
dcterms:title: RSO (Random Synthetic Oversampling)
